website_summaries.verdict: Comfortable harness that works nicely for connecting a leash or for car rides.
pros: Makes use of 3M reflective material in the harness to create safer conditions when walking at night
Multiple color choices and sizes available
Extra padding in the chest and belly areas for the comfort of the dog
Straps are adjustable across the harness, which helps you create the perfect fit
cons: Has some elastic in the design, and a strong dog may be able to pull it loose

website_summaries.verdict: A robust no-pull harness that’s packed with just about every feature you could ask for. Comes in a variety of bright color options and reflective stitching ideal for nighttime or early morning walks.
pros: Features dual leash connectors for walking versatility
A combination of mesh and sponge padding delivers superior comfort
Duraflex buckle boasts a large load capacity to withstand intense pressure and tension
Comes in a range of eye-catching colors

customer_reviews.title: Nice harness except for the armpit injuries
customer_reviews.text: Initially I thought this was the best harness ever! It's goes on easy, simple to adjust, looks sharp and has a handle! However, after 2 days of use, my poor dogs armpits look like they were attacked by a cheese grater. I wondered why he didn't have any pep in his step when fetching his ball today until I saw his bloodied, raw armpits. A few more inches of padding or fleece could have completely prevented this issue. Due to my dog being injured by this harness, I cannot recommend it. The picture only shows an edge of the injured area. He was understandably sore and wouldn't allow for much positioning.
customer_reviews.author: Fischergirl

customer_reviews.title: I was initially very happy with this harness
customer_reviews.text: I was initially very happy with this harness. It worked perfectly for our needs. Unfortunately, after only two months of light to medium usage, one of the plastic fastening clips has broken, rendering the harness useless. Though this isn't the most expensive harness available, I would expect more than two months of use before product failure. I tried to find information on the company online in order to request a replacement part but the website for Chai's Choice simply directs you back to Amazon for product purchases and has no customer service contact information. Buyer beware of what appears to be a fly-by-night company with no intention of standing by their products.
customer_reviews.author: Tanja van der Veen

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality. Broke after 32 days!
customer_reviews.text: I was thrilled with this product when I received it. It really does help with pulling (I have a Husky, so pulling is in his DNA!). HOWEVER, and this is a huge however, I've literally had this for 32 days and it has broken!!! (See photos). The quality is obviously not as high as I'd hoped, but for $25, it should have lasted more than a month. If it broke after a year, I would buy another, but I can not justify purchasing a new harness every month ($300 in a year?!). Nope. If your dog is a puller (which this product is geared toward), I wouldn't risk it. I was lucky he didn't run away!
customer_reviews.author: A. Anschuetz

customer_reviews.title: Buckles break easily
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this harness twice and the buckles have snapped twice. I have two strong labs that pull hard which is why I wanted a front range harness. The first time they replaced the harness for me for free and now the second time the company Chai's Choice refused to help replace the harness. They offered to replace the clip, but replied "You can only replace the prong (male end) of the buckle. If the (female end) of the buckle is damaged then you will have to contact Amazon customer service to see if they will replace the harness." They know that Amazon won't replace the item because of their return policy. Cannot recommend this harness.
customer_reviews.author: Nick F.

customer_reviews.title: A great harness at a great price.  Looks great, too.
customer_reviews.text: My 85 lb. Husky-mix loves to walk along the bayou near my house. His old harness wore out so I checked reviews and bought this one, about a month ago. It was easy to adjust to his size. We both really like it. When I get it down off the shelf, he knows we're about to go for a walk, and he gets all excited. It has a good strong steel d-ring for attaching the leash, and seems to be well-constructed. I got the fluorescent orange one and really like how it looks on him. I'll add a photo this weekend. Happy to find a great product like this through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mike In Houston TXTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Def NOT for my 20# dog!
customer_reviews.text: Trying to find a harness with handle for some ninja Parkour sporting with my smaller dog. Nope. First off VERY small for my dog despite carefully choosing from the shown fit info with description. It fit on widest strap settings but because the clips are so bulky, the entire harness seems INCREDIBLY uncomfortable for him. Would not put him through trying to break it in. I put it on him (he is used to several harnesses I use) and he stood there and couldn't wait till I took it off. I would say the company needs more research on comfort for small/med dogs.
customer_reviews.author: MGW

customer_reviews.title: MY DOG GOT LOOSE
customer_reviews.text: it’s a well constructed harness. Very comfortable for my German shepherd. However when it comes to security of other people I would rate this product very Low. The spot where the leash hooks on broke and my dog got loose. This may not be a big deal for some dog owners, but for those of us who have aggressive animals that can do harm to other people it is important to have a secure harness. unfortunately mine broke, and I have attached a photo of the part that broke. Which is the main connection for a leash. I am fortunate that nobody was harmed due to this poor quality "connection" between the dog and the leash.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: And you can't get the front loop too snug or it won't come off the dog's head easily - or att all
customer_reviews.text: It's all about the sizing. The front ring doesn't work effectively unless the neck loop is snug. And you can't get the front loop too snug or it won't come off the dog's head easily - or at all. Hopefully, our pup grows into it where it's snug without the front loop being too small. Overall it works well, seems to have OK padding and it's well made. **Update - material is fraying after only two weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: A.T.

customer_reviews.title: Very, very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My dog wears this every day for every walk and often in between walks. He seems fairly comfortable in it, even though he chews on other harnesses we’ve tried. We used some carabiners to attach the leash to the harness; my dog actually managed to break several of the carabiners, but the harness stayed in tact each and every time (we’ve since upgraded to nicer carabiners and haven’t had any problems with him escaping). It’s been over a year of tough use, and it seems sturdy as ever. The handle is especially useful for keeping my dog close when something tempting is around, like a squirrel.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Working
customer_reviews.text: My dog is not a big dog but very strong and capable of pulling me off my feet. After the last fall, I had to do something so I ordered this harness and the lead to go with it. I can't say all of the pulling has stopped by he is much more responsive to a tug than before and it is much easier to walk him. I hope with time, he will respond even better. As of today, walking with him is 90 percent easier.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Hancock

customer_reviews.title: On the fence...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not quite sure about this harness.. it may be a little too bulky for my 6lb Yorkie (xs). I love the concepts and features of the harness, but in order for the chest area to fit him, it makes his head have to SQUISH through the opening. Otherwise the neck/chest area is too loose and he can get his lower jaw underneath to chew on it. I think I (and my puppy) would love it more if there was a way to have a buckle that opened around the neck rather than having to go over the head... Unfortunately I might have to send it back even though I really wanted to love it.
customer_reviews.author: RDange

customer_reviews.title: Loved by both animals, puppy almost dog and the human walker
customer_reviews.text: This is is for a goldendoodle who thinks he is still an eight pound puppy. He learned to love the the harness because it means going outside.The 2 clips are great. At this point, I have purchase all 4 sizes for my "nephew". He does not fit into the extra large, yet. He does not care about the color but my friend loves the color and the matching leash. It is very well constructed and made to last. She has had no problem getting the correct fit using the various sizers. It was not on the breeder's suggested list but I selected it based on the clips and overall construction.
customer_reviews.author: honorvhr

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: I have looked at a dozen harnesses this past year, looking for the perfect "no-pull." This is the best yet. It's well made, with padding on the underside as well as the top, which makes a lot more sense to me. Many of the other harnesses had substantial padding on the top and nothing but straps on the bottom. I think the bigger surface area on the underside is necessary to maximize the pressure distribution and make it safer for the dog. ~ My dog has an 18" girth so I ordered a small (17-22). The fit was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: dlh

customer_reviews.title: Inability to open duraflex buckles
customer_reviews.text: I received your harness, it looks very strong and well constructed. However, I am unable to open the duraflex harness buckles. I've tried several times on this harness and had the same results on the second harness I purchased from this vender. I noted that other customers have encountered the same product snag (hiccup). I considered using pliers, WD-40, crescent wrench, dipping buckle into boiling hot water. HELP !!! I HAVE SUBMITTED A NOTE TO THE VENDER EXPRESSING MY DISSATISFACTION. TO DATE THERE HAS BEEN NO RESPONSE. Amazon advised of this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and escape-proof!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had two of these since 10/2015. They’re awesome! They’ve lost a little bit of their brightness color-wise just due to repeated laundering, but they’re incredibly sturdy and so cute! We have two dogs; one is a flight risk, so a solid harness her can’t slip out of is imperative! The other dog for one just because we like for them to match (I know...). I can’t recommend these highly enough. We bought one orange and one yellow. I’m tempted to order two more for when these wear out, but that won’t happen anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Superior Harness!
customer_reviews.text: I've now used this harness for one week with our two West Highland White Terriers, and I'm extremely satisfied with it. I did have to order a larger size to replace the first, smaller one--my dogs are at the upper range of the small size. Medium, however, works great. The harness is easy to adjust and also easy to put on. And I particularly like the stability of the harness. Even when my dogs pull, I now have much better control than I did with the style of harness I had previously been using. Chai's Choice is excellent in design and sturdy in construction!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Dr.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Kong harness for my Beagle-mix which is pretty good harness. He wears the harness whenever he goes for a ride in a car. The Chai harness covers a bit more of the chest area than the Kong one and does not have a piece of hard plastic that could potentially strike him in the throat, as the dog is attached to a seat belt by a Vastar car seat leash. The Chai harness also goes on a lot easier than the Kong harness; instead of having to slide his left foreleg into the harness you just bring the chest section underneath him and fasten two clips. A good piece of equipment for him.
customer_reviews.author: Terry M.

customer_reviews.title: Seemed good but had to return
customer_reviews.text: I have a 70 lb. lab mix who needed a new harness. We run and hike a lot with her so wanted something suitable for those activities. We thought we’d tried Chai’s since it had good reviews. It’s nice quality with reflectors. However, we ended up returning it because the neck part couldn’t fit right. She was in between 2 sizes when we measured her so went with the larger size. Guess it was too large for her neck or maybe it’s her build.
customer_reviews.author: cck103

customer_reviews.title: This was completely the wrong shape for our Jack Russell ...
customer_reviews.text: This was completely the wrong shape for our Jack Russell terrier. Not the wrong size - it just couldn't be modified enough and a smaller or lager size would have been too baggy or tight. The material is also really really stiff so it would never mould to his body type even if the ropes and fastens were able to get round him properly. He's a very athletic build with a big chest and skinny back end. Also was really really hard to modify and put on even if it had fit him! There are much nicer harnesses on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel M (real person not a robot)

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: Other front hook harness (easy walk) fit awkwardly at the shoulder blades and across the front. This is bulkier but well made and clearly more comfortable. The neck opening slides a little when the dogs try to pull (squirrel), but not in a way that creates discomfort or undermines the purpose. I love the multiple hook locations, and the easy removal with two side clips. My husband didn't think he'd use these because they'd be too much bother but he now uses them regularly when he walks the dogs. And the dogs stand still for them to be put on - they don't fuss so I think they rather like them. A +
customer_reviews.author: thebeta99Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Super impressive for money. Updated super impressive harness and seller
customer_reviews.text: Really nice I just wanted to do a update My bordercolie/pit mix has been wearing this harness for about a month now and I couldn't be happier with it. My pup is three months old and still growing so I will definitely be purchasing at least a couple more of these amazing for the money harnesses. I would say something like this quality would be around $40 at a pet store. I also had a question for the seller about washing the harness and ask him on his YouTube video in the late evening and I got a response the same night.
customer_reviews.author: chad grover

customer_reviews.title: GREAT HARNESS!
customer_reviews.text: The beautifully ugly, bright orange color makes me feel safer while walking my dog. It has reflectors on it so if we're out at night he can be seen. This harness is sturdy & appears to be comfortable on my picky dog. (He hates most harnesses, as do I!!) It's easy to put & remove. It gives me enough control to curtail his pulling or if he gets into a dangerous or sticky situation. You can leash him up on top of his back or in front of his chest for maximum control. This is a great harness. Thank you Chai's Choice for your quality products!
customer_reviews.author: BunnysSpirit

customer_reviews.title: Cheap thing broke after less than 60 days
customer_reviews.text: I actually give it NEGATIVE Stars, if I could, as I have only had it for less than 60 days and one of the straps just broke coming in from a walk. It seemed like it was going to be a great harness and even had a bunch of room for my dog to grow into it, but unless I get some really quick and satisfying replacement and refund service then I will be looking for a better quality product and will never use this seller again. I will happily change this review if and when I get this problem resolved, until then I am one very unsatisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best harness I’ve found. Stops pulling.
customer_reviews.text: This harness is fantastic. I tried three different harnesses and looked at the local big box pet stores and local boutique pet stores and didn’t find anything even close to this one. Front harnesses make a big difference when you have a dog who has a tendency to pull. By having the attachment in the front the dog is turned back towards you if he jumps out in front. If the harness attaches on the back, it can make the pulling worse. If using just a leash and collar, it puts a lot of pressure on the throat. This harness solved the pulling problem immediately. So glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Mirna

customer_reviews.title: Order a larger size DOES NOT reduce pulling.
customer_reviews.text: Its a great harness. However it DOES NOT reduce pulling at allo and only serves to tangle and trip your pup. Additionally, My pup measures 20" ad his widest girth, and that allows for plenty of room with fingers below the harness (4) _ The small is supposed to fit up to 22" and it is by far to small and snug. Its difficult to adjust as well. I was hoping for something to help deter pulling. This is not the product for that. I was going to post a pic of his measurements but I don't see that option available.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Steward

customer_reviews.title: Saved my dogs life
customer_reviews.text: Out for a morning walk. Our 11 year old terrier mix rescue dog is still very curious, and protective. Barks at any other dog that comes near. Another dog approached and she tried to bark but couldn't. Her mouth was open but no sound. I decided she must have something in her throat. She would not / could not drop it so I picked her up by her harness, effectively performing a type of Heimlich maneuver. Out popped the joint of a chicken bone. Not so surprisingly she wanted it back. We continued on our walk and her barker was fixed. Thanks to Chai's Choice Tori lives to bark another day.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Not escape proof
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our muggle for camping ang hiking. It is very reflective and looks nice. However that's about all. She is constantly getting out of it and getting loose. We have adjusted it down snugly as possible without it being too tight and still she ends up out of it. Just didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Great Harness
customer_reviews.text: This harness works very well for our Border Collie though she is still adjusting. We use it mostly for car rides when I want to have her harnessed to the seat belt strap. Her size was right at the largest measure for the medium size and thanks to other reviews I read I ordered the next size up, a large. I don't think the medium would have fit so if your dog measures at the high end order the next size up. I chose this harness because it was recommended by other family members who have also been very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Pease

customer_reviews.title: Love this harness...l
customer_reviews.text: I'm so excited with this harness... I have been looking for a very long time and have even purchased 2 others which I have despised... This harness is made sturdy... Extremely well! I purchased a Medium for my 25 lb goldendoodle (chest size 20") and it's absolutely perfect! (FYI there's a video on youtube that shows you exactly how to adjust it) it helped me... I'm hoping it last a very long time! I couldn't wait to share this information w/ everyone because I review everything before I purchase things... Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: mj2u

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is wrong
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Teal Blue in an extra large, but the harness size is equal to a LARGE, not an Extra Large. My dog's chest circumference is 33 1/2 inches. The harness I received expands to only 32 inches - (the advertised large is 27-32 while the Extra Large is 32-42). All the tags attached to the harness say it is an XL, but the chest straps prove that the tags are wrong. (If the sizing had of been true - I think I would have really liked this harness.
customer_reviews.author: Moscow ID Amazon Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: My pet coyote always has the tendency to pull at the beginning of every walk. She would pull to the point of coughing and hacking, which made me feel terrible. I was looking for a harness that had a front clip and something that would be comfortable on her. This harness fits the bill. We just came back from our first walk and the harness worked great! No pulling at all from beginning to end. Although she looks sad in the photo, I assure you she is quite thrilled. Sizing was accurate according to the chart. Would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Dog Harness for 110 lb Livestock Guard Dog
customer_reviews.text: We got this exact harness 3 years ago. Our livestock guard dog has worn it 24/7, and it was starting to look a bit worse for the wear, so we just bought her a new one. The new one is every bit as well made as the original. Given the beating the first one has taken and survived during the past three years, I wouldn't think of trying another brand. At any price, the quality is excellent--and there are dog harnesses that are way more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Nice harness, seems like good quality.  Didnt stop dog from pulling
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this harness for my dog.. he walks great most of the time, but anytime we are getting closer to home or the car he pulls like crazy, so I was hoping this would help.. It didn't.. he still pulled just the same, but since I had the leash hooked to the front, it really just pulled the front chest portion over which restricted his front leg movement, but still didnt stop him. I was honestly afraid he would slip his leg out that way, so I switched it to the back clasp. Not sure if i'm going to keep or try something else. Overall it seems like a nice harness though, looks more comfortable than what we had..
customer_reviews.author: Maui0924

customer_reviews.title: good vest if my dog wasn't between sizes.
customer_reviews.text: i would have gave it 5 stars but my chihuahua has a small neck and a large chest. his neck is xsmall size and his chest is a small. i think its 11" neck and a 17" chest. its a good looking harness. to bad my dog is swimming in the harness around the neck.came on time . would be happy if my dog could use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Walks are enjoyable again!
customer_reviews.text: Great harness I got a medium for my 30 pound border collie and it fit great! At first I thought it was too big but you can change the straps to make it smaller or bigger which is great if she grows. I bought this because she pulls on the leash a lot even with a normal harness, but with the front range leash thingy you gain so much more control, yes she still pulls but it's a weak pull. The difference is night and day hopefully, this will make training a bit easier. The harness its self is great quality easy to put on, and well built. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Already pulling apart in the straps after two weekends of use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in March to specifically use during camping season. I purchased this color and another, to have one for each of our dogs. Last weekend (first camping trip) it worked great. This weekend however it let us down. This morning during our walk, the harness strap started pulling apart. It is currently held together by two threads. At the time, my 75 pound Husky/Lab mix wasn't even pulling hard. I am now worried the same will happen with the second one I have for our Husky. With paying around $25 I would have expected them to last longer than two weekends.
customer_reviews.author: 78silverwolf

customer_reviews.title: Great Harness
customer_reviews.text: Great overall harness. I Purchased a Large color Black for my 40lb Shepherd mix and he still has room to grow in it. Its build tough and I find the reflectiveness a very nice feature. It also includes a mesh like pocket on the chest to hold id tags and minimize clanking. The only issue I have with this harness is that the leash clip on the top does not swivel. We use a dog jacket with a vertical slit for leash attachments and the harness clip is horizontal so this makes it a bit annoying to attach. Other then that it a pretty sweet harness!
customer_reviews.author: tiffany

customer_reviews.title: One of the best harnesses overall - Long hair could be an issue
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best harnesses I have tried on my dog. Only issue is the threads on the inside can catch hair so it depends on your dog hair length. Otherwise it is a great product overall. Very durable, handle on the back comes in handy more than expected, D-ring (where you hook the leash) is double stitched so pulling issue is accommodated, front D-ring has double loop and works for no-pull training but D-ring on back is comparatively much more stronger.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: best.harness.ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best harness because: 1. prevents neck problems in smaller dogs 2. super safe, does not come off, regardless of the efforts of my beagle 3. you can adjust it to their size so they feel safe and comfortable 4. if you use the front loop (on the chest) you can control their pulling much better 5. machine washable 6. they just look great (unimportant to the Dog, I know) 7. size fits as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia C

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog Harness
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's great dane... it's been a godsend... keeps him from "pulling" so much... seems to be a comfortable fit as well... would definitely recommend this one... if I had to identify any shortcoming, it would be to add some wool pads to the harness to make it at least more aesthetically comfortable for the dog, the dog can't speak to it, so it's probably just my two cents if I had to wear it, lmboooooooo.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one
customer_reviews.text: I love this harness so much. I got a Shiba puppy in December and the handle has been extremely useful lol. She's starting to outgrow it now and I'll have to get her a size medium shortly. She's a very good pupper so I couldn't say how it holds up to escapees, harness chewers, or leash pullers. I picked this harness because I read shibas are escape artists who love to pull and tear things up so I scouered reviews and questions of multiple harnesses and this one came out on top for me
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Fits my wide chested boxer with room to spare
customer_reviews.text: The quality and the size are perfect. I purchased this as my older boxer is having leg issues and uses a ramp, but often doesn't walk a straight line so she tends to walk off the side. This will allow me to hold the handle and guide her. It has worked so far, however, she hates the feeling of being confined so she will not walk in it. Once down the ramp She parks herself and wont move unless I change her into a collar. I am not sure if the straps hurt under her legs or if she wants to show who is boss.
customer_reviews.author: Liz S

customer_reviews.title: Her Royal Houndness loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this for my Bassett hound and am very pleased with the fit and quality of this harness. It is sturdy, easy to adjust and easy to put on/take off. Our diva hound loves it too. She has been prancing around showing it off. She is a puller when she gets a scent or sees other animals She feels should be chased. She tried chasing a moose 3 months ago while we were camping so I needed something to control her better without having my arm torn from its socket. She broke her last harness and this one looks like it will handle her enthusiasm. The handle will help very much. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Braiellen

customer_reviews.title: Much Better Control that a Collar Provides
customer_reviews.text: A very strong and adjustable harness. If your dog pulls much, using the front hook makes it very easy to control the dog. They will not pull be able to pull hard. And unlike using their collar, the harness will not cause them to cough or choke when they do pull on the leash. I will not walk my dogs anymore using a just their collar. Easy to adjust and to get on and off. I have bought three of these now for my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for training
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a XL for my 9 month old 60 pound puppy. It fits her perfect on the smallest setting with room to grow. I love the handle on the back to help redirect her when she’s distracted or just gain more control. She’s very strong! She’s was able to back her way out of other types of harness, but not this one. The color and reflective stitching is great. I’m very pleased with this product and will likely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: cyesh

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic harness!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I have 3 dogs and they each have one of these! One medium, one large, and one XL! By far my favorite harness! I’ve had 4, and the only one I had to get rid of got chewed on 😭 The material is strong and even my 100lb Doberman mix has done great. When I got him he wasn’t safe to walk on a leash because he pulled SO HARD and this harness made it super easy to correct the behavior. We go to stores and the beach now without issues! I can even push a cart in tractor supply and not worry about him trying to pull me around.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't fit my 100 pound Golden Retriever. I ordered the XL, watched the stupid video, fooled around for a half hour and after adjusting it all the way out it wouldn't fit, too small. First gripe is the fact their is no instruction manual. Probably made in China. Second the straps are hard to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: paul m.

customer_reviews.title: This has helped decrease our feral pup's pulling at least 50%
customer_reviews.text: I waited to write this review - I watched the video and read the reviews. We have a medium size Jindo who loves to pull. She's literally at a 45 degree angle to the ground, pulling away from her walker! With this, my 13 year old daughter has much more control. She still tries to pull, but the fact that the front clasp spins her towards the handler is brilliant and it deters her from pulling too hard. Very sturdy and well made - very thick dernier nylon and webbing. It does take a bit to adjust it correctly, but it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: MamaTechGeekPrincessShopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Slipped out backwards. Pulls regardless.
customer_reviews.text: I really had high hopes for the harness based on reviews. However, my 37 pound beagle who pulls like a 500 horse power engine was actually able to slip out of it when the leash got wrapped around a street sign. He literally backed out of it and got loose. When I use the front clip he continues to pull but the harness just turns sideways. Did not help with his pulling and cannot seem to get it tight enough to prevent backing out.
customer_reviews.author: LBO

customer_reviews.title: Get This One First, Don't Waste Your Time on The Others!
customer_reviews.text: This was the fourth harness I tried for my little Chihuahua. Every other one was a disaster. Honestly, I had almost given up trying to find one that was well-made, adjustable where I needed it to be, and comfortable for him. But the Chia's Choice was perfect! He actually likes wearing it, and he is a stubborn little cuss. He weighs about 6 pounds, and with the adjustments on the harness, it could be made to custom fit him. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamel Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Be careful when using sizing instructions.
customer_reviews.text: It looks great and seems highly effective and we wanted to love it but unfortunately, the sizing directions were not accurate for us. We followed them exactly as informed (measuring instructions and all) but the harness was still too small for our dog, even with the straps extended to their loosest position. We ordered a large, as suggested by following the directions provided by the seller. It says a large fits chest size 27-32 inches and our dog measured 31 inches. I recommend sizing up if your dog is a bit closer to the upper threshold for sizing.
customer_reviews.author: LdyFrnd

customer_reviews.title: Fixed our pulling problem in a few minutes
customer_reviews.text: We recently rescued an older but very strong pit bull who had never been trained to walk on leash properly. She would pull like crazy and had completely ignore us. As soon as we started using this harness with some basic heeling techniques she stopped pulling and started walking calmly. The key is to use the chest loop for the leash. It does wonders!
customer_reviews.author: Ohana Films

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Harness, Fragile Buckles
customer_reviews.text: I have a great dane/labrador (labradane), and we loved this harness. He has major anxiety and he would panic when I took this harness off so he found some comfort in wearing it most of the time. Very sturdy as a whole, love the handle, and never had any chafing or rubbing problems. My only complaint is that the plastic quick release buckles are quite fragile and one of them busted after about 4 months of steady use. Overall for the price, and the period it lasted vs the size and strength of my dog, I am pleased and will be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha

customer_reviews.title: Replacement parts?
customer_reviews.text: I bought 5 of these and the buckle on one of them immediately snapped - or at least one part of it did. I will come back and change this rating if I find that it is possible to get replacement buckles. I have a feeling that this is going to be an ongoing problem. I have returned the defective one but I am dismayed that it is not possible to reach the manufacturer. He has a YouTube video and I thought that it would be possible to resolve this without returning the halter. It is easy to swap out buckles.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen H. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Cannot adjust the straps atound hetneck to stay
customer_reviews.text: I have a 75 pound lab. I ordered xlg. It fits her fine through the chest, but way too big around the neck. It seems like you can adjust the straps around theneck. But when you do this and pull up on the leash the straps losen up and the neck area is too largd again. There is no way to lock in the straps once you try to tighten them. A large wpukd bd too small around her chest. Very disspointed i. This harness. Will try to return it.
customer_reviews.author: tl

customer_reviews.title: This is the one that worked!
customer_reviews.text: I had a foster dog, 24" around at the chest, and tried ordering the body glove styles, one piece padded material styles, with upper limit of 24" chest, but they were way too small and basically not adjustable except the overlapping velcro on the back had about an inch of play but that wasn't enough. But this harness is terrific for a small dog (like mini Australian Shepherd or a sheltie). Very adjustable on the front piece and the strap that goes around the belly. The dog seemed comfortable in it right away.
customer_reviews.author: P. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: will definitely buy another one once he outgrows this one
customer_reviews.text: The color is pretty and my puppy looks so good in it. I don’t think it gives him any discomfort. I love the buckle on the back so now he can’t mess with the leash. The handle is quite small though but that might just be because I bought an XS. Although watching the youtube video on how to adjust it, the straps were a little difficult. The only big problem I have is that it is too loose around his neck but I can’t make it any tighter or else it won’t fit around his head.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah McCaffrey

customer_reviews.title: I love my dog and finding a harness to fit a ...
customer_reviews.text: Our Dog is huge and this just barely fits... I love my dog and finding a harness to fit a 140-lb big chested, large head Rottie is not easy... I wish I would have take a picture of him when we pulled it out of the bag as he sniffed it then looked at us then started going crazy as he knew it was time for a walk (or a ride in the car) Once on his body and adjusted as much as we could, he pranced around like the King he is... (His name is; "His Majesty King Solomon")
customer_reviews.author: Meredith S Jones

customer_reviews.title: High 5 to the creators of this harness!
customer_reviews.text: High 5 to the person who made this. It’s been great. We have a 70lb goldendoodle who gets very excited on walks and has a tendency to pull. This has been fantastic. He naturally spins himself around when he pulls and has learned to walk so much nicer because of it. And it’s comfortable and built very well. He pulls HARD on it. The stitching is great and has held up to all of the pulling. I keep checking it over just to be sure and so far I haven’t noticed any pulling or extension in the stitches. It’s great! He gets so excited when he sees me pull it out because he knows he’s going for a walk!
customer_reviews.author: Mandla83

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a nice quality and this harness is that! love it. It is also super easy to put on.I bought this for my boston terrier and the little handle on top worked out great. I will be buying another one for my other boston. I always like to try one out first. I would recommend anyone to purchase this.Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Justine P.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Adjust & Get on Over the Dog's Head
customer_reviews.text: I apparently have a strangely shaped dog, as this is the third harness I've bought... it's just hard to get it to fit right. It's really hard to explain, but I'll just say that adjusting the fit isn't easy. Also, the fact that one has to slide the entire collar over the dog's face as opposed to clipping it on like a regular collar frightens my dog every time. I've had to use treats to get him to accept putting this on over his head. It's getting the job done, but not well.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome harness!!
customer_reviews.text: The best harness in the universe!! Except it's made in China, but what isn't? The only downside is you have to adjust it quite frequently, it doesn't stay in place everyday, but other than that it's really awesome! The 3M reflective material, 2 leash attachment points (D-ring & O-ring) and bright orange color is why I bought it in the first place. It's better than a Puppia which is mesh and falls apart after just 4 months. I've had this harness since June and it looks brand new!! It's the best!!
customer_reviews.author: E. MILLER

customer_reviews.title: Useful harness for contolling pulling, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item to control train my golden retriever. He is a strong 1 1/2 year old who has a tendency to pull. I have been using the lower attachment point to control some of his energy. The is easy to use and can be attached with one hand which I need due to a hand injury. I have had for only a short time and therefore cannot comment on long term sturdiness but it appears solid
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: Reflective Vest
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the reflective vest for my grandpuppy as I have them for my own dogs. He really likes the new harness because when he is on his leash it is pulling like his old one. I like how that you can adjust it also for his growth. I also like the fact that it is reflective so when he is being walked late in the evening it shows up good. I will continue to purchase this type of harness.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I bought the harnesses because the vet recommended them after one of my bassets had back surgery and because they are safer for tethering the dogs in the back of my SUV. These harnesses are of excellent quality and workmanship and I am very pleased with them. I had. to watch the video a couple times before I figured out how to adjust the straps. A little more clarity would be helpful in explaining how the harnesses fit on the dog and how tightly they should fit. I am very impressed with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Ann91

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had researched harnesses for days and finally decided on this one mostly because it had a front AND back clip. I had read front clips are best for lose leash training a puppy and once they learn the back clip is ideal. Our dog loves this. The quality is great and the reflectors are a good add on. We have also found that the handle on the back has been very helpful with out energetic puppy... he is also automatically better behaved once we put it on. I have already purchased the next size up for him and bought one for my parents dog!
customer_reviews.author: Niki R.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality harness but serious armpit abrasions
customer_reviews.text: I've used this harness for almost a year now with our 70lb golden retriever. I've used it on walks, hikes, and runs and overall the quality of the material appears to be high. It has stood up well to the elements and his pulling. The top handle strap is very convenient for restraining him when he gets overly excited around other dogs and people. However, after using the harness for several 2-3 mile runs/hikes, I've discovered large 2-3" abrasions in both armpits that were scabbed over. Seems like anything more than walking causes this. Well-made harness but the injuries are forcing me to look elsewhere now.
customer_reviews.author: lex

customer_reviews.title: Sporty and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: My 54lb, border collie loves his new harness. He has a 30'' chest and the size LG harness adjusted to fit perfectly. It is extremely easy to put on and it doesn't seem to rub his underarms. It is very sporty, and the neon green looks stellar on dogs with black fur! I recommend this product, however I believe no matter what type of product you use to walk your dog, they will pull regardless unless you, as his master, put forth effort into training him to walk by your side and remain under your control.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: HOT PINK!
customer_reviews.text: I love the hot pink color. I bought the matching leash. This is my second harness. She grew out of her first harness and I loved it so much I bought a second one, one size up. If it’s her perfectly and I know she can’t get out of it like she does with other harnesses I tried. She doesn’t mind wearing it when she goes out for a walk so I guess it’s comfortable. She’s not complaining.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Feels off balance
customer_reviews.text: The anchor points to connect a leash to the harness seems to be at an odd angle for the dog. It makes me feel like I have less control of his body. It is nice to have the front and back connection but they aren’t at his center of gravity. It’s possible I don’t have a good size. It also seems that there is some elasticity to the straps. I like the easy on easy off feature of the harness.
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: ... half ago for my 9 month old boxer and loved the harness
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a month and a half ago for my 9 month old boxer and loved the harness, the handle was awesome..... Very very useful. Unfortunately this weekend he was outside on his long cable, which we rarely use, within 20 minutes he snapped the harness straps in half..... Not the plastic connector, the actual straps. I have not been able to get ahold of the seller and am outside the 30 day return window. I guess I just have a $30 useless harness.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlie

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Dog loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this harness. My dog is very comfortable in it. It's high visibility at night because of the reflective strips (she is a Kerry Blue Terrier, so hard to see at night!). The clips are in great positions. It's easy to put on and take off. It's not too heavy and clunky. I originally ordered the 17"-22" one because that's what my dog's measurements are, but she has a large chest, narrow waist, and long body for her size/weight and other measurements, so she actually really needed a size up. Returning the small one and ordering the next size up was a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: YES

customer_reviews.title: I love this harness so much I bought two
customer_reviews.text: I love this harness so much I bought two! I was worried because after prolonged use, there obviously was a smell. So I washed it with baby wash when I was giving my dog a bath. But after it dried it still smelled. So I re washed the harness with some liquid detergent, and the smell came out, so no problems with this harness. Pros: reflective material, section for tags to be tucked in/no jingling noise, easy to put on/take off, able to adjust to size/grow into, great color. Easy to wash. Con: None.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey S.

customer_reviews.title: These harnesses are amazing! I just adopted two Siberian huskies
customer_reviews.text: These harnesses are amazing! I just adopted two Siberian huskies, who love to pull, so I was in search for harnesses that not only had a front clip, but were also study and would withstand the wrath that is my puppies. I have had them for two months now and they work so well! I love the front clip, especially on days where they insist on pulling more. And there is also a handle on the back that you can grab to hold the dog, which is super helpful. I have gotten a ton of compliments and questions about these harnesses, as everyone loves them. Wonderful product; I will purchase these for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: DakotaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It runs extremely small
customer_reviews.text: I measured my dog and he was between a medium and a large. I went with a large. It was way too small. I have no idea how they were able to squeeze one onto the husky they show in the picture. I'm trying to figure out how to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Shinn

customer_reviews.title: Strong Strong Strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 110 lb dog and it actually fits him. It is very easy to take on and off. Has the grab handle on top that is very useful. It has very reflective strips for dark conditions and it really does light up so I know vehicles can see us. The padding is soft and in all the right places. Plus it is strong, strong, strong. I recommend this harness.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie S

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Harness
customer_reviews.text: We got this orange Chai harness for our bullmastiff about a year ago and still use it on a daily basis. I got the red this year for the holidays. The colors are bright and you can see the reflective thread on it when we go out at night to walk her. The harness is padded and doesnt rub her anywhere. We love that you can hook it at the top back or on the front chest for more control. Definately a great price and quality compared to other harnesses we have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Custom Fit Harness
customer_reviews.text: I have a 10 month old Bichon. She is still growing and is not fully proportioned yet. What I really appreciated about the harness is that you can independently adjust the chest and shoulder/neck areas. The result is a very secure and sturdy set-up. I bought the leash that goes with it as well. That was more for me. It is so comfortable in my hand. Really, this is a great product. For you and your canine friend.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: My Aussie used to like to pull.
customer_reviews.text: My 55 lb Aussie likes to pull. The link just on his chest just in front of his forelegs completely discourages pulling. If he tries pulling, the leash and harness tug him sideways. It bugs the heck out of him, so no pulling. This is easier to place and remove than 2 other harnesses i have used. Just poke his head through and clip behind each foreleg. Very quick.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the two leash rings (one on the back and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have an 80lb Husky/Lab mix and he immediately responded to this harness and hasn't pulled since.It's adjustable in all 4 quadrants. I originally bought a Kong heavy duty harness, but the largest they make (38 inches) wasn't big enough for his chest. This fits him well and he measures probably 39-40 inches.I tightened it down quite a ways, so if you're dog is bigger it would probably fit well. I like the two leash rings (one on the back and one on the chest). The chest ring really keeps him from getting out of hand. The reflective gear is great and it seems to be well-made.
customer_reviews.author: dk DO

customer_reviews.title: Three years and still great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to secure my pet well but with comfort. The handle is priceless since coyotes are a major problem here and helps since I can pick him up in a mili-second. The harness hasn't worn nor failed in any areas. 16lb dog in a small harness. He is a strong puller when he wants to be and this harness has gone through some very hard sessions and performed beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: BReview

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy harness
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this harness in the wrong size and had to return it. Once I got the replacement I was immediately pleased with it. There's a lot of straps to adjust which can be annoying when your dog can't sit still, but it's allowed me to fit the harness perfectly to my dogs chest and neck area. She has a big barrel chest and smaller neck/head so it can be tricky sometimes. All the metal loops have held up against her pulling and jerking around and the handle on the back is also really helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Quality product but not for every pet
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality harness. However our dog is akin to Houdini in that she can manage to wiggle out of it. It seems impossible given the design but when you see her in action you'd be amazed. The device isn’t too loose either. I'm till giving it a 5 star rating because it's made well, but do know that it’s possible for a pet to get free of it if you keep tension on the leash. If your dog is 'normal' this would be a great choice. We still use it but reprimand our pooch or drop the leash when she starts her wiggling.
customer_reviews.author: Chops1958

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: After years of my dogs pulling me down every time they saw a rabbit or a squirrel, I finally got wise to this type of leash. The dogs' previous hranesses were very high quality (as this harness is), but attached on the dogs' backs. Not good with two big dogs who love chasing wildlife! This front-mount leash harness is amazing! We only have one dog now, and he's the strongest of the those we've had, but he's been unable to pull me down. Thank you, thank you! I don't heal as quickly as I used to!
customer_reviews.author: Hagen LeBray

customer_reviews.title: Good quality material. The buckles make it easy to put on and take off.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this over a year ago for our husky who thinks she’s an escape artist. She did escape from this a few times in the beginning. We didn’t have it as tight but we learned her fluffiness allowed her to back out while you had tension on the leash. Simply tightened more and haven’t had that problem since. She runs around the dog park with it on, with no problems. She sleeps with it on and is very cozy.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Great harness...I bought 2.
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy harness! So well-made, I bought another for my second dog (who already had a harness, but it was an ugly orange color). If you put it on the back of the dog and you have a crazy, Australian shepherd puppy like mine, the dog will tend to pull. You can hook the leash to the front and it will discourage pulling, (but the dog may get turned around). There is a convenient handle on the back to restrain the dog, or clip your poop bag container to it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Chang

customer_reviews.title: This harness seems to be pretty sturdy, but i did not test it out
customer_reviews.text: This harness seems to be pretty sturdy, but i did not test it out. It does not fit my 60 lb pit bull well. I measured him before i ordered and ordered a large. It fits all the way around, but it pulls weird around the check and makes the harness pucker up on the front of his chest and then the straps are pulled right up under his arm... so that is going to rub and hurt when he walks. The straps were fully extended...i just think this wasn't designed for a large chested dog like a pit bull.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Best Harness Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one and they are great! The current one we bought almost three years ago and it is still going strong. My pug/Boston mix is insane! She is aggressive which is why we bought it in the first place. It is super easy to grab her and pull her up when she tries to go after other dogs. She also pulls a lot and has pulled me over on more than one occasion but this makes her pulling manageable. Highly recommend. We have a large and she is about 40-45 pounds and very muscular.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Helps with leash training!
customer_reviews.text: My 6-month old puppy was being a nightmare for leash training. He would pull so hard on his traditional leash and collar that he would start to pant. I ordered this harness for him and it didn't take long for him to notice how it was better so much and more comfortable. Not only that but leash training is much better and he is doing great during our daily walks. The handle on the back has been great to keep in in check when he get overly friendly with people who aren't fans of dogs. I will definitely purchasing more in the future of this harness!
customer_reviews.author: Debi C

customer_reviews.title: I like it but in practice it doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Broke one of the clips fairly soon after purchase. We put on a new clip. In theory, I like it but in practice it doesn't work. Our dog just hates a leash. So if the harness is tight enough for her to stay in it, it rubs under her legs raw. If it's loose enough to not rub she can wiggle out. If you have a dog who isn't a wriggling puller, it's a pretty good harness (except for the cheap clips.) I like the two hook ups.
customer_reviews.author: EllE

customer_reviews.title: Quality harness
customer_reviews.text: The harness is made from good material, is well constructed, and is easy to put on our dog. It is also light weight so should be comfortable. We like that it has two rings for attaching a leash. Our dog weighs 70 lbs. so is strong and she chokes herself pulling too hard with a regular collar/leash. We've also tried a gentle lead but she really doesn't like the strap around her snout and will push it off with her paw whenever possible. We've only used the harness once so far; so she is still in her learning curve for something new. As she enjoys going for walks, we really hope she takes to the harness.
customer_reviews.author: SuzyQ

customer_reviews.title: Large fits 70lbs German Shepherd very well
customer_reviews.text: I bought the large for my 1 (maybe 1,5) year old, 70 lbs, german shepherd and it fits really well! There's even room for him to grow or get smaller. It took me a minute to figure out how to adjust everything, but now it fits nicely. I have only used the "back" attachment for the leash since he's not a bad puller. It's a great orange color and the reflective parts are great! I can even see the reflection when it's really sunny out.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Used daily for over 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this brand of harness on my dog since I brought her home as a puppy. She chewed through the buckles once when she was in her destructive phase, but I didn't hesitate to buy a replacement. She never seems bothered wearing the harness and it's held up to her pulling, even when she decides to bolt after a rabbit. This is a kick-ass harness.
customer_reviews.author: Crew

customer_reviews.title: No more tugging! I own you now little dog!
customer_reviews.text: My dog pulls so hard he’ll literally choke himself with a normal leashed collar. Same goes with a standard harness. But with this little gem, he can’t. See, if he pulls it simply tugs him sideways towards me. Further, if he pulls it interferes with the gait of his front legs so he can’t walk forcefully. It works so well that I can almost see the frustration on his face as he slowly (very slowly) comes to the realization that he can’t pull me along anymore! Bwahahahaha! The tables have turned my pet!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good Product: 4 stars not 5 though.
customer_reviews.text: Good product over all. Time will of course tell just how durable the harness is but as of this writing it is serving it's purpose well. Two things made me rate this purchase a 4 and not 5 star. 1) The product is listed as a Prime product, yet I ordered it on 3/7/2017 and did not receive it until 3/14/2017. There are reasons we joined as Prime members and 2-day delivery was one of them. 2) The handle on the of the harness is rather small. You cannot put your whole hand through it. The mfr. should perhaps consider a redesign. All in all a good product with the exceptions noted above.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Partington

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: We had purchased a much more expensive harness for our 56 pound pit mix but it kept coming unbuckled all the time.😳 Luckily, one day when we weren’t home she ripped it to shreds. I guess she didn’t like it either. We purchased a Chai’s Choice Outdoor Adventure Harness and are very happy with it. Our two granddogs have them, too. It is a very sturdy harness and easy to put on. I would highly recommend it to anyone who has a strong dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great harness
customer_reviews.text: I like that it can be used as a chest attachment for dog's that pull and a back clip attachment for those that just need a harness. Well padded. BUT negatives are real difficult to adjust and it does stretch out after the dog pulling on the leash, so needs readjust. But, I have purchased many and highly recommend them in my dog training classes.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth M. Olsen

customer_reviews.title: The harness is of good quality but just a poor fit for my pup
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this based on the reviews but I couldn't make it work. My dog is a puller, so I use the front clip; however, the harness constantly loosened during walks, so I had to adjust every 10 minutes. My boy is a rescue and while tall and skinny, he also has a very broad chest for his size. I could never adjust the neck straps tight enough, so it was a fail on all levels. The harness is of good quality but just a poor fit for my pup.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Gertrude

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made, sturdy harness. My foster boxer mix is 70lbs of pure muscle, built like a tank. She pulled uncontrollably in a regular collar. Even my husband had trouble walking her. As soon as we put the harness on, we had complete control. If she runs ahead or lunges at something she gets jerked around to face me. I love the handle on the back which gives me even more control over her when we encounter other dogs. This harness makes walking her a pleasure! I bought a large and it fits her well.
customer_reviews.author: lulu cline

customer_reviews.title: The Ultimate Harness!  None other compare!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best/nicest harness I've purchased and will be the last! The photo doesn't do it justice. Really quality constructed. Quality materials etc. If I ever need to purchase another harness I will definitely repurchase this one! Adjusts nicely! No areas of chafing, etc. on my dog. Seems to ride very comfortably against their body. Really well constructed chest plate and nicely padded and seems comfortable against their chest/skin. (I ordered two for my two Shelties). I not only use them for walking, I use them to harness them in the backseat of my Outback. Can't say enough about these harnesses... Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: JMason

product_meta.title: Chai's Choice Best Outdoor Adventure Dog Harness. 3M Reflective Vest with Two Leash Attachments. Caution - Please Measure Dog Before Ordering! Matching Leash and Collar Available
product_meta.description:
Size:Large| Color:Orange

This is the Stylish, Safe, and Durable Dog Harness Vest you have been waiting for!

Chai’s Choice Outdoor Adventure Dog Harness Vest eliminates pressure from your dog’s neck preventing possible neck, spine, and windpipe injuries. Even if your dog is not a puller, he or she could be injured wearing a collar if they make a quick move to chase a squirrel, dog, or person. From a training perspective, dog harnesses are useful for teaching your dog not to pull as the pressure from a harness is more evenly distributed around your dog’s body.

Made to last - This durable harness is made of scratch-resistant oxford material to prevent against wear-and-tear. This harness is made of quality materials that is made to last.

Safety first - Keep your precious pup safe with nylon webbing reflective material which provides excellent visibility at night. Also features a sturdy handle on the back of the harness for looping the seat belt through to secure your dog while riding in your vehicle.

Ergonomic design – Lightweight mesh lining with soft sponge padding in the chest and belly keeps your dog comfortable on their walks and discourages pulling. The adjustable straps allow for a custom fit to make your pup as comfortable as possible. Our harness is a safe, durable alternative to other collars and prevents choking and injuries to the neck, spine, and windpipe.
feature_bullets: STYLISH & DURABLE - Outer layer made of scratch-resistant oxford material. Lightweight Duraflex buckle with large loading capacity greatly improves tensile strength
ERGONOMIC DESIGN - Ease of use putting on and taking off harness. Comfortable lightweight mesh lining with soft sponge padding in chest and belly
STRAP ADJUSTMENT - Push then pull straps through buckle for a custom fitting. Two leash attachment points: Zinc-alloy D-ring on dog's back and webbing with Zinc-alloy O-ring on dog's chest
SAFETY FEATURES - Nylon webbing with 3M reflective material for good visibility at night and sturdy handle for easy seat belt attachment while riding in your car
CHAI’S CHOICE - Based in Riverview, FL, Chai’s Choice offers high quality pet products and is owned by a retired US Navy veteran
